question: Question_01_(f)
statement: State the strong principle of mathematical induction.
sols:
Strong mathematical induction is a method to prove a statement
\emph{S}(\emph{n}) is true for all natural numbers \emph{n}. It is given
by the following.

Suppose that for every natural number \emph{n}, that we have the
implication

\begin{align*}\big(\forall\,k < n, S(k)\big) \Rightarrow S(n)\end{align*}

Then for every natural number \emph{n}, the statement \emph{S}(\emph{n})
is true.
hints:
Mathematical induction involves wanting to prove statements over all
natural numbers. How do we do this?
